titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Herbert Alton Hoisington (1882-1943) and Eunice Julia Kingsbury Hoisington (1885-1976) served the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. as lay foreign missionaries in Cameroon, West Africa. Herbert Hoisington was born in Illinois in 1882 and received his B.A. from Wheaton College in 1905. He received additional training in business at the Institute and Training School for Employed Officers of the YMCA and in divinity at the McCormick Theological Seminary. In 1910 he married Eunice Kingsbury, also a native of Illinois.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to the Hoisingtons' service in the West Africa Mission in Cameroon, dating primarily from the 1930s to the 1960s. Materials include: missionary reports (including reports of Eunice K. Hoisington); newsletters, including The Drum Call and Mefoe Memvok, the newsletter of the West African Mission; correspondence from the Hoisingtons to family and friends; typescripts and manuscripts of talks on mission work in Africa and talks to African audiences; notes on the culture and language of Cameroon; proof copies of the gospels in Banoko, with some copyediting annotation; and printed gospels, primers, and other educational and religious texts published by Board of World Missions and Board of Foreign Mission. Some of the printed materials are in Bulu and Banoko.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Hoisington Family Papers (RG 221).
